_metadata.title: Records Management - Regulatory Records Declaration
_metadata.description: Configures retention labels with record declaration and regulatory lock for formal records management. Creates 'Official Business Record' (7-year, record label) and 'Regulatory Record' (7-year, regulatory lock) labels that prevent content modification or deletion once applied. Regulatory records meet SEC 17a-4 WORM storage requirements.
requiredLicences: Microsoft 365 E5 Information Protection and Governance

prerequisites: Connect to Security & Compliance PowerShell: Connect-IPPSSession
Microsoft 365 E5 Compliance or Records Management add-on is required for regulatory records
Records management must be enabled in the Microsoft Purview compliance portal
Legal review completed for record declaration and regulatory lock requirements
CRITICAL: Regulatory record labels cannot be removed once applied to content - content is locked immutably
Users with record label permissions must understand the implications of declaring records

recordTypes.recordLabel: Content marked as a record can be modified with version tracking but cannot be deleted during the retention period. Administrators can unlock if needed.
recordTypes.regulatoryRecordLabel: Content marked as a regulatory record cannot be modified, deleted, or have the label removed for the entire retention period. This is IRREVERSIBLE and meets WORM requirements.

deploymentSteps: 2. Enable Records Management in the compliance portal if not already active
3. Create the Official Business Record label with IsRecordLabel flag
4. Create the Regulatory Record label with both IsRecordLabel and Regulatory flags
5. Publish labels via a retention label policy
6. Configure auto-apply policies for known record types (optional)
7. Train records managers on label application and implications
_notes.rollbackProcedure: Record labels: Remove-ComplianceTag can remove unpublished labels. Published record labels must first be removed from content. CRITICAL: Regulatory record labels CANNOT be removed from content once applied - content remains locked for the full retention period.

parameters.Name: Official Business Record
parameters.Comment: Declares content as an official business record. Record cannot be deleted during 7-year retention period. Content versioning is tracked. Administrator can unlock if needed.

parameters.Name: Regulatory Record
parameters.Comment: Declares content as an immutable regulatory record. Content CANNOT be modified, deleted, or have the label removed for the entire 7-year retention period. Meets SEC 17a-4 WORM requirements. THIS IS IRREVERSIBLE.

parameters.Name: PV25-RecordsManagement-PublishPolicy
parameters.Comment: Publishes record and regulatory record retention labels to all users across Exchange, SharePoint, and OneDrive for records declaration.

recordLabels.name: Official Business Record
recordLabels.description: Standard record declaration - prevents deletion, allows versioned modifications

recordLabels.name: Regulatory Record
recordLabels.description: Immutable regulatory record - prevents all modification and deletion (WORM)
